parts.text: The next total solar eclipse visible from the United States will be on March 30, 2033, but it will only be visible in parts of Alaska. If you're in the contiguous United States (the Lower 48), you'll have to wait until August 22, 2044, when totality will cross through Montana, North Dakota, and South Dakota. There's another major total solar eclipse crossing a wider portion of the US, from California to Florida, happening on August 12, 2045.

web.title: When is the next total solar eclipse in the USA?

segment.text: The next total solar eclipse visible from the United States will be on March 30, 2033, but it will only be visible in parts of Alaska.
If you're in the contiguous United States (the Lower 48), you'll have to wait until August 22, 2044, when totality will cross through Montana, North Dakota, and South Dakota.
There's another major total solar eclipse crossing a wider portion of the US, from California to Florida, happening on August 12, 2045.
